meanings.definition: Characterized by sudden, jerky movements or vibrations.
meanings.sent1: The old car made a juddery noise as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake left the town feeling juddery for days.
meanings.sent3: The juddery dance moves of the robot made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt juddery with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The juddery ride on the rollercoaster was both thrilling and scary.

meanings.definition: Causing or experiencing shaking or trembling.
meanings.sent1: The juddery engine of the plane made the passengers nervous.
meanings.sent2: The juddery hands of the old man showed his fear.
meanings.sent3: The juddery ground beneath them made it hard to stand still.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded juddery as he tried to speak in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The juddery feeling in her legs made her realize she was truly scared.
